speaker: FLAKITA
line: Quiet! Quiet, listen to me. It was a terrible thing. You’re not going to believe me, even when I tell you. Some say it is a story, a fairy tale. But I saw it. I saw it with my own eyes.

speaker: ANGLO MAN
line: Quiero hombres fuertes. Rapido. Let’s go. Vamos.

speaker: ELADIO
line: I missed you last night, my love.

speaker: MARIA
line: I’m not your love

speaker: SOLEDAD
line: Gracias.

speaker: MARIA
line: Your brother will see us. He says I’m breaking his heart.

speaker: ELADIO
line: Are you?

speaker: MARIA
line: No.

speaker: ELADIO
line: Si.

speaker: MARIA
line: No.

speaker: MARIA
line: No. Are you calling me a liar?

speaker: ELADIO
line: Si.

speaker: FLAKITA
line: Maria! What are you doing? The goats! The goats are escaping!

speaker: FLAKITA
line: Two brothers. One woman. Trouble.

speaker: VILLAGE WOMAN
line: nan

speaker: FLAKITA
line: Mm hmm.

speaker: FLAKITA
line: Look – the rain is strange.

speaker: FLAKITA
line: Look at the water - it’s yellow. Las cabras. Maria! Maria! Maria! Maria!

speaker: FLAKITA
line: Madre de Dios.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, this happened how long ago?

speaker: MULDER
line: Tres dias. Muy incredible, no?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Only the smell. Mulder, you brought me out here on the pretense of investigating an unexplained death. Can you tell me why we’re standing out here in the middle of a field looking at a dead goat?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, according to eyewitnesses, the death we’re investigating was preceded by a Fortean event. That’s a highly unusual or infrequent meteorological phenomenon also known as a transient.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A transient.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. Witnesses described a bright flash about 30 degrees off the horizon, then a hot yellow rain fell from a cloudless sky. Fortean researchers call these "liquid falls." Black and red rains are the most common, but there have also been reported cases of blue, purple and green rains.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Purple rain?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. Great album. Deeply flawed movie, though.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, this "transient," as you call it, this bright flash in the sky - I assume you think it has some connection to -

speaker: MULDER
line: Fortean events have been linked to alien encounters, cattle mutilations, the kind of exsanguinated animal carcass you were just looking at.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And the victim, Maria Dorantes, did she die in a similar fashion?

speaker: MULDER
line: I would assume so.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You assume? Nobody’s examined the body?

speaker: MULDER
line: Nobody cares, Scully. The victim and many of the witnesses are illegal immigrants. Migrant farm workers.

speaker: MULDER
line: I thought it might be important to talk to them. Before they migrated.

speaker: FLAKITA
line: La Migra! La Migra!

speaker: MULDER
line: No La Migra! No La Migra!

speaker: SCULLY
line: No La Migra, no La Migra.

speaker: MULDER
line: No La Migra.

speaker: SCULLY
line: La FBI, no La Migra.

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s all right. We don’t want to take anybody away. Relax. No, it’s okay. Tranquile.

speaker: FLAKITA
line: What do you want?

speaker: MULDER
line: We want to know what happened to Maria Dorantes. Does anybody know what happened to Maria Dorantes? Did anybody see anything?

speaker: FLAKITA
line: El Chupacabra. That’s what happened to Maria Dorantes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: El Chupacabra?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, its a Mexican folktale. El Chupacabra, the goatsucker. It’s a small gray creature with a big head and a small body and big black bulging eyes.

speaker: FLAKITA
line: Si! Si! Si. Light. Then rain. Then La Chupacabra. He comes and eats away Maria’s eyes and face.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you see the Chupacabra?

speaker: FLAKITA
line: No. But everyone here knows that this is the truth.

speaker: SOLEDAD
line: This woman’s a liar! There is no Chupacabra. The Chupacabra is nothing but a story told to children. I know the killer of Maria Dorantes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who would that be, sir?

speaker: SOLEDAD
line: It’s my brother, Eladio Buente. He killed Maria because she loved only me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh, how do you explain the uh, the yellow rain and the dead goat over the hill?

speaker: SOLEDAD
line: It’s a trick for fools who believe in fools’ superstitions.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you, Mr. Buente. You’ve been very helpful.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maria... Maria... I just met a girl named Maria.

speaker: MULDER
line: I doesn’t make a whole lot of sense, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It makes perfect sense, Mulder. Admit it. You fell for it. Your "Fortean Event" turned out to be nothing more than the oldest story in the world. Two men. One woman. Trouble.

speaker: MULDER
line: I admit, there’s a strong suspicion of motive and intent - but the amount of detail, the description of that Chupacabra...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what we’ve walked into here is a Mexican soap opera, and one for the local cops.

speaker: MULDER
line: Local cops don’t care, Scully. I don’t know who does.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay, I care, but what are we supposed to do about it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Find out what killed Maria Dorantes. Take a look at her body.

speaker: SCULLY
line: While you do what?

speaker: MULDER
line: Try to find this man, Eladio Buente.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Lozano? I’m Special Agent Mulder. I’m with the FBI.

speaker: LOZANO
line: The FBI? Here?

speaker: MULDER
line: We’re investigating the death of a migrant worker.

speaker: LAZANO
line: Really?

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m looking for a man named Eladio Buente. He hasn’t been seen for three days and he’s not in police custody. I thought he might be in INS custody.

speaker: LOZANO
line: He might. Let’s see. Okay! We have a Jose Feliciano. We have Juan Valdez, we have Cesar Chavez, we have Placido Domingo here. But I don’t see any Eladio Buente

speaker: MULDER
line: So you are telling me that no one here uses their real name.

speaker: LOZANO
line: What is this man wanted for?

speaker: MULDER
line: Possibly the murder of a woman named Maria Dorantes.

speaker: LOZANO
line: Oh, man. The Chupacabra?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. You’ve heard of it. You don’t believe in it?

speaker: LOZANO
line: I believe these people. But their lives are small. So they have to make these fantasies just to keep on going - to feel alive. Because they are strangers here. They feel hated, unwanted. Whenever their passions become inflamed, they resort to violence. And then they cannot turn to the law, so they make up these fantastic tales. Call it anything you want, but this is an age old story.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’ve heard that.

speaker: LAZANO
line: Well, let’s see if we can find your Eladio Buente.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me? Excuse me?

speaker: CORONER
line: Can I help you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m Agent Dana Scully with the FBI. I’m investigating the death of a migrant worker.

speaker: CORONER
line: Juan or Juanita?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m sorry?

speaker: CORONER
line: Doe. A man or a woman?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, a woman named Maria Dorantes. I need to determine a cause of death in order to close out an investigation.

speaker: CORONER
line: Oh, it sounds vaguely familiar, but I don’t think I’ve been able to get to her, yet.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I’m a medical doctor. If you show me the body I can examine it myself.

speaker: CORONER
line: It’s in the fridge.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t think he’s going anywhere.

speaker: CORONER
line: That’s her.

speaker: CORONER
line: Oh, my God.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why is he segregated like this?

speaker: LOZANO
line: Por que lo tiene segregado?

speaker: GUARD
line: Los otros detenidos lo molesteban mucho. Ninguno se la aserga a el. La tienen un miedo terrible.

speaker: LOZANO
line: He said that the other detainees were giving him a hard time. Causing trouble. They don’t want to go near him.

speaker: MULDER
line: They think he’s the Chupacabra.

speaker: LOZANO
line: That may be, but I will tell you with a tremendous degree of certainty this guy is not Erik Estrada.

speaker: (MULDER SMILES. THEY LOOK AT HIS FOLDER
line: ERIK ESTRADA, HISP, M, 6-0, 190, CALIF, USA)

speaker: LOZANO
line: Buente!

speaker: LOZANO
line: El fbi. Quieren hacerte unas pregunttas.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ask him if he killed Maria Dorantes.

speaker: LOZANO
line: Quiere sabar si mataste a Maria Dorantes?

speaker: ELADIO
line: No! No lo hice! Soy innocente! No soy asesino!!

speaker: MULDER
line: What did he say?

speaker: LOZANO
line: "I didn’t do it."

speaker: MULDER
line: Ask him what happened.

speaker: LOZANO
line: Que fue lo que paso?

speaker: ELADIO
line: Huvo un ruido cumo un relampago muy cerca...

speaker: LOZANO
line: "There was a noise like thunder, but very close .."

speaker: ELADIO
line: ...un rayo muy brilliante ..

speaker: LOZANO
line: "...and then there was lightening, very bright. It blinded me. I fell to the ground, and then I felt the hot rain fall on me. And when I finally could open my eyes and see..."

speaker: LOZANO
line: "...I saw the dead goat. And then I saw Maria... Maria. She called my name... once. She was lying in a puddle of yellow rain. Something had eaten at her face. Then I held her in my arms. Then she died. And then I got up, and I ran, screaming.

speaker: ELADIO
line: Soy innocente!!!!

speaker: LOZANO
line: This guy’s *better* than Erik Estrada.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hmm.

speaker: MULDER
line: What’s going to happen to him?

speaker: LOZANO
line: He’ll get his 45 seconds before the judge, and he’ll be placed on a south bound bus.

speaker: MULDER
line: There any way to delay that?

speaker: LOZANO
line: Why would you want to do that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Try to solve an unexplained death.

speaker: LOZANO
line: I would think the FBI’s got better things to do. File your paperwork. By the time they process it, he’ll probably be back here, anyway.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you find Eladio Buente?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, I found him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did he confess to the murder of Maria Dorantes?

speaker: MULDER
line: Not exactly, no.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did he tell you what happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: Flash of light... yellow rain .. Maria! Maria!!!

speaker: SCULLY
line: He didn’t kill her, Mulder. I examined the body of Maria Dorantes, and I believe that her cause of death was natural, albeit strange. She seems to have succumb to a massive fungal infection.

speaker: MULDER
line: A fungus?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Aspergillis, according to the coroner. It’s a mold that's found in dead leaves, compost, even household dust.

speaker: MULDER
line: And it can kill?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not normally. It’s actually very common and quite harmless.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don’t think that’s weird.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, aspergillis can be lethal to people with immunodeficiencies like AIDS patients and ah, transplant recipients. And I found high levels of methyl bromide in her blood workup. It’s a - a pesticide that’s used for soil sterilization. Highly toxic. Now I think that her body was so ravaged by pesticides that a normally benign fungus may have compromised her whole immune system.

speaker: MULDER
line: It still doesn’t explain the flash of light and the yellow rain. And El Chupacabra.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I know you don’t want to hear this, but I think the aliens in this story are not the villains. They’re the victims.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look at that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What does it look like?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It appears this man died of systemic shock. Brought on by what appears to be another massive fungal infection

speaker: MULDER
line: The same fungus that killed Maria Dorantes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. It looks dissimilar. I don’t know what this is. But its speed and its aggressiveness are frightening. The infection’s covered 90 percent of his body, Mulder, through both layers of skin.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you find him?

speaker: LOZANO
line: We were able to round up most of the people who escaped from this vehicle but Eladio Buente wasn’t among them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No one knows where he ran?

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Lozano, this is my partner, Agent Scully.

speaker: LOZANO
line: They all ran the other way, away from the Chupacabra. The man they say is responsible for this tragedy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Eladio Buente didn’t kill this man. He didn’t kill anybody.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m not so sure about that, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, this is the work of a pathogen of - of some kind of a highly virulent strain.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m not questioning that, but right now Eladio Buente is the only connection we have to this death and to the death of Maria Dorantes, which is why I need you to spare any manpower you can to try to find him.

speaker: LOZANO
line: Manpower? We don’t have the resources to go chasing after one poor illegal.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, whatever you hope to learn by finding this man we have to first make a definitive classification of the fungi taken from the victims. I need to isolate it and I need to get a sample of it to a mycologist as quickly as possible.

speaker: MULDER
line: Good. You should do that. While Agent Lozano and I try to find El Chupacabra.

speaker: ELADIO
line: Senor?

speaker: BARBER
line: What do you want?

speaker: ELADIO
line: I need to go back to Mexico.

speaker: BARBER
line: You want to go back? Estas loco?

speaker: ELADIO
line: I know you have a truck – the one that brought me here.

speaker: BARBER
line: We haul mucho basura with that truck. What makes you think we haul it back?

speaker: ELADIO
line: Your driver must go back to the border. I need him to take me. I’ll pay you.

speaker: BARBER
line: Give me money.

speaker: ELADIO
line: I have no money now, but I’ll give it to you when I return to Mexico.

speaker: BARBER
line: How long have you been in this country? Ni credito! Ni caridad. Equi es America, you dumb wet.

speaker: ELADIO
line: Please, I’ll get the money. I must leave here.

speaker: BARBER
line: Truck stop at dusk. No dinero, no ride. Comprende?

speaker: ELADIO
line: Si. Dinero.

speaker: BARBER
line: Dinero.

speaker: CULVER
line: Construction. I need two construction workers. Dos! Okay, you two in the back. Let’s go.

speaker: CULVER
line: I only need two, amigo. Dos. Hey, out of the truck. I got work to do. Hey, where are you going?

speaker: CULVER
line: You’ll have to do.

speaker: STEEN
line: What you’re looking at, Agent Scully, is the most ubiquitous fungal spore known to mankind - dermatophytosis.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Athlete’s foot?

speaker: STEEN
line: One of the survivors of countless extermination efforts. Historically underrated. And unfairly overshadowed by the ever-popular cockroach.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But our body has natural defenses against this kind of invasion. I mean, even in the absence of an immunoresponse a fungi like this one or like the aspergillis sample that I gave you, don’t they need the right environment to multiply?

speaker: STEEN
line: Yes, unless they have help.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What’s this?

speaker: STEEN
line: It’s an enzyme I isolated from both your specimens, but that’s about all I can tell you. It’s unlike any enzyme I’ve ever seen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So it’s not the fungi, but the enzyme that kills.

speaker: STEEN
line: Acting as a catalyst. As an accelerant. Let me show you. This is pucchinia graminis. Black stain rust. It’s been the cause of a fairly containable crop blight here in the Valley. Now---

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my God.

speaker: STEEN
line: I must say if this were to get out into the environment, dermatophytosis might give the cockroach a run for its money. Hmm?

speaker: LOZANO
line: Gracias. He was here, all right. They say he got into the truck a foreman named Culver.

speaker: MULDER
line: The story’s out.

speaker: LOZANO
line: Oh, yeah. I told you. These people love their stories. It’s the one thing that keeps them from going mad when they’re out there standing on the street corner all day waiting for work.

speaker: MULDER
line: So they really don’t think he’s the Chupacabra?

speaker: LOZANO
line: No. They’re certain of it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you tell them about the fungal infection?

speaker: LOZANO
line: Yeah, they wouldn’t listen. They’re only interested in what will become of Eladio Buente.

speaker: MULDER
line: What will become of him?

speaker: LOZANO
line: When his brother finds him?

speaker: MULDER
line: He’ll kill him

speaker: LOZANO
line: Yes, probably. A man cannot live with vengeance in his heart.

speaker: MULDER
line: So we got to find him first.

speaker: LOZANO
line: My mother used to say that blood should be left to cleanse itself. God curses the man who stands between two brothers.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, in this case, he’ll curse the man who doesn’t.

speaker: ELADIO
line: Senor? Senor? Jefe? Senor Culver?

speaker: ELDAIO
line: Jefe? Hey, Jefe?

speaker: SOLEDAD
line: Eladio Buente! Eladio?

speaker: SOLEDAD
line: Eladio Buente. Come out of there! Come out like a man so I can split open your face, bastard.

speaker: SOLEDAD
line: Assesino!!!

speaker: ELADIO
line: Gabrielle! Gabrielle!

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: What are you doing here, Eladio

speaker: ELADIO
line: I’m going to Mexico. Come with me, Gabrielle.

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: Have you lost your mind? Do you want me to lose my job?

speaker: ELADIO
line: I’m very afraid. My brother wants to kill me for something I didn’t do.

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: They say that you are the Chupacabra, and that you killed Maria Dorantes and many more.

speaker: ELADIO
line: Gabrielle, I’m not a killer.

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: Quiet! The lady of the house will hear us.

speaker: ELADIO
line: I need your help. I need money.

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: My job at the market pays me tonight.

speaker: ELADIO
line: Gabrielle, I can’t wait.

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: Eladio!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it’s me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully. Where are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m at the state university bio department. Mulder, listen to me. I think you’re right. I think Eladio Buente is responsible for those two deaths.

speaker: MULDER
line: Responsible, how?

speaker: SCULLY
line: By spreading an enzyme produced by what appears to be a new strain of conidial fungi.

speaker: MULDER
line: How’s he spreading it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: My guess is by touch.

speaker: MULDER
line: I saw this man, Scully. He was unaffected.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He could be just a carrier, then – a kind of Typhoid Mary.

speaker: MULDER
line: You’re saying it’s a new strain?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. Mulder, it’s extremely important that you not come into direct contact with this fungus. You must not inhale it, you must not touch it...

speaker: MULDER
line: Lozano, careful. Scully, I’ve been thinking. I know that’s dangerous, but just bear with me. These Fortean transients that the women described? They could have been caused by an object falling at a high rate of speed through the atmosphere creating a sonic boom and a flash of light. What astronomers call a bollide.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A bollide?

speaker: MULDER
line: Created by a meteorite or a piece of extraplanetary material - of which two thousand tons falls to the Earth every day. Now - now this yellow rain. Space debris could have fallen into a nearby lake superheating the water and sending it skyward. Which would mean this is alien.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I think this is beside the point, right now.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, and the fungus...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, let me work on the fungus, okay? What you need to do is to find the man who might be spreading it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Kay.

speaker: LOZANO
line: So. You’ve got your own "stories" too, huh?

speaker: LOZANO
line: Hey, it’s El Barbera.

speaker: BARBER
line: Hey, Lozano. I hear you’re looking for the Chupacabra. For a modest fee, I can tell you where he might be found.

speaker: MULDER
line: Eladio! Don’t touch him.

speaker: MULDER
line: I lost him!

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh!

speaker: SCULLY
line: More goats.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Lozano! How does this man keep eluding us?

speaker: LOZANO
line: These people are invisible. You look at them and you don’t see them. They’re just workers - cheap labor to pick crops and clean houses. To most people they are aliens in the true sense of the word.

speaker: FLAKITA
line: Ay, Chupacabra!

speaker: LOZANO
line: It’s okay. Calm down, calm down.

speaker: FLAKITA
line: Can a man do this? Can Eladio Buente do this? Eladio, he went to his cousin, Gabrielle’s house asking for money.

speaker: LOZANO
line: When?

speaker: FLAKITA
line: Today! He say he kill nobody. But Soledad, he went to Gabrielle’s house trying to kill Eladio.

speaker: LOZANO
line: Calm down.

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: Quien es?

speaker: LOZANO
line: Gabrielle Buente. This is Agent Lozano, INS.

speaker: LOZANO
line: Where is he?

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: Que?

speaker: LOZANO
line: Don’t give me your "que." You know who. Where is he? Eladio.

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: He is not here, please. I would not let Eladio Buente in here. Please, you must believe me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe you should check the back.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about his brother, Soledad?

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: No. He is not here! No one is here! I am alone!

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you seen either of them?

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: Si. But I am afraid. Because of what they say about Eladio. About El Chupacabra.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There is no El Chupacabra, Gabrielle. Eladio is a very sick man. If he comes here, you must not let him in. If he comes to this door you must call the police. Do you understand?

speaker: LOZANO
line: There’s nobody. I’m going to be watching you, Chiquita. Every move. Comprendes?

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: Si.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think we should hold up a moment.

speaker: SCULLY
line: For what?

speaker: MULDER
line: Something’s going on here.

speaker: STORE CLERK
line: Hey, Jose! This ain’t no restaurant! You know you have to pay for all that!

speaker: STORE CLERK
line: Hey what are you doing? Come back here! Hey, you have to clean that up!

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s our man.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Eladio Buente?

speaker: LOZANO
line: No. That’s his brother - Soledad.

speaker: ELADIO
line: Bueno.

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: Eladio?

speaker: ELADIO
line: Si, Gabrielle. Where are you? Why didn’t you come to work?

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: Listen to me, Eladio. Soledad - I could only lie to him so long. Eladio? Eladio!!?

speaker: LOZANO
line: Soledad Buente! Stop, stop!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Drop your weapon!

speaker: MULDER
line: Drop the gun!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Drop it!

speaker: LOZANO
line: Fuetala!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Put it down! Now!

speaker: MULDER
line: Apurate! Drop it!

speaker: LOZANO
line: Fuetala!

speaker: SOLEDAD
line: I only want vengeance. My own brother killed my Maria. I want the revenge of brother against brother. I must avenge her death. Solo quiero vengarme, pues!

speaker: LOZANO
line: nan

speaker: SOLEDAD
line: Eladio!!!

speaker: LOZANO
line: Quiet, loco!

speaker: SOLEDAD
line: nan

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: He’s been here.

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: Quien es?

speaker: ELADIO
line: Eladio.

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: Eladio? What’s wrong? What happened to you?

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: No.

speaker: ELADIO
line: What are you afraid of?

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: Look! Look at your face!

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: You are what they say you are.

speaker: ELADIO
line: No.

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: You killed Maria Dorantes!

speaker: ELADIO
line: No!

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: You are the Chupacabra.

speaker: ELADIO
line: Nooooo!! Nooooooooooo!!!!!!!

speaker: MULDER
line: Eladio? Eladio Buente?

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: He’s not here. He’s gone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Gone where?

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: To Mexico. Where he can hide his terrible face.

speaker: MULDER
line: How’s he going to get to Mexico?

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: I gave him all my money!

speaker: SCULLY
line: You gave him your money?

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: Yes! Because I was afraid. I was afraid that the Chupacabra would kill me, too!

speaker: LOZANO
line: What can I say?

speaker: MULDER
line: How are we going to find this man?

speaker: LOZANO
line: Good luck. I’m gonna go process the brother.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know, what she said about Eladio Buente, about his face...

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know what to believe anymore, Scully. These people sure love their stories.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, he could be anywhere right now. If - if he were to enter a metropolitan area with what he’s carrying...

speaker: MULDER
line: He won’t.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If he’s going to Mexico...

speaker: MULDER
line: She’s lying. If this man really thinks he killed Maria Dorantes, he won’t be going to Mexico.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then where is he going?

speaker: MULDER
line: The same place Agent Lozano and Eladio’s brother are going. He’s going to face his brother.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t understand.

speaker: MULDER
line: God curses the man who stands between two brothers. Get on your cell phone and have a haz-mat team assembled.

speaker: LOZANO
line: Eladio Buente! Come on out! Be a man and face your brother!

speaker: FLAKITA
line: Madre de Dios.

speaker: FLAKITA
line: Eladio, NOOOOOO!!!!!!

speaker: FLAKITA
line: Y me dicho la Chupacabra.

speaker: FLAKITA
line: They came from the sky, more Chupacabras.

speaker: FLAKITA
line: Coming to save Eladio. I slammed the door and prayed that they would not come to kill me, too.

speaker: VILLAGE GIRL
line: What will happen to Soledad.

speaker: FLAKITA
line: He was taken up by a Chupacabra. He will suffer for his treachery. He is made to suck the blood of only the sick and dying goats when the Chupacabra comes to feed.

speaker: VILLAGE GIRL 2
line: That is not what Gabrille says.

speaker: FLAKITA
line: What does Gabrielle know?! I was there! I saw it with my own eyes.

speaker: VILLAGE GIRL
line: Gabrielle says she lied to La FBI, so that her cousin, Eladio, might live. But La Migra Lozano knew that Soledad could not live with vengeance in his heart.

speaker: LOZANO
line: Alto! Turn around and face the man whose love you killed!

speaker: SOLEDAD
line: You killed Maria! Because she wouldn’t love you! Because her heart belongs to only one man! Don’t make me shoot you in the back, Eladio! Turn! See my tears! Turn around like a man!

speaker: ELADIO
line: No. I am not a man! I am the Chupacabra!

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: "Shoot! Shoot!" La Migra shouted. But Soledad began to cry. "No! No!" cried Soledad. I cannot shoot my brother! He is my brother! My flesh, my blood."

speaker: LOZANO
line: Shoot him! He’s El Chupacabra!

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: ...shouted La Migra.

speaker: LOZANO
line: We cannot let him go!

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: "He is the goat-sucker and he must be killed!" But Soledad, he could not kill Eladio because he knew I would never forgive him.

speaker: MEN
line: Que paso? Que paso?

speaker: LOZANO
line: Cobarde!

speaker: SOLEDAD
line: No! No!

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: La Migra Lozano tried to pull the gun from Soledad’s hand, calling him a coward. "No!" cried Soledad. "He is my brother!" And the gun went off. Bang! Bang! And La Migra Lozano fell dead.

speaker: MEN
line: Ah, esta buena!

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: Pero, no! La Migra Lozano brought Soledad to kill Eladio so he would not be cursed. So God cursed Soledad for his treachery and turned him into El Chupacabra - like his brother.

speaker: MAN
line: Have you seen him? Your cousin?

speaker: GABRIELLE
line: No. Together, they run. To Mexico.

speaker: SKINNER
line: El Chupacabra?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Frankly, I’m confused by this story.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t blame you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We can’t exactly explain it ourselves, sir.

speaker: MULDER
line: At any rate, we arrived just after the haz-mat team...

speaker: MULDER
line: They established a perimeter, then secured the area. An eyewitness was found, but her testimony was questionable.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The Haz-mat team were able to contain the fungal infection within the migrant camp. No other casualties were reported. And we found no other traces of the accelerating enzyme.

speaker: MULDER
line: Except on the body of Agent Lozano. We found him dead at the scene with a bullet wound to the chest.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And the fungal infection already starting to eat away at him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What happened to the brothers?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They were nowhere to be found. Lozano’s revolver turned up ten miles away near the car of a man known locally as El Barbera.

speaker: MULDER
line: Apparently, the brothers paid this man for a ride to Mexico, but they didn’t get very far.

speaker: SKINNER
line: So these men are still at large, carrying a highly contagious... fungus, that can kill a man in his tracks?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s not a fungus, sir. Actually, it’s an enzyme to which the brothers had an abnormal tolerance, and which came from what I believe to be an anti-enzyme gene.

speaker: SKINNER
line: And this enzyme came from where?

speaker: MULDER
line: Outer space, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: So this is the story you’re asking me to report? You would think that with the resources we have we’d be able to find these men. I’m not hearing a good explanation of why this hasn’t happened.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, sir, they, um...They have a way of being almost invisible.

speaker: MULDER
line: The truth is, nobody cares.
